title: Dish
text: While <I>kraak<I> porcelain found particular popularity in Europe, China was producing <I>Swatow ware<I> for export to Japan, Southeast Asia, India, and Indonesia.  Named for a port city from which they were exported, these dishes have a distinctively gritty glaze and were made along the southern coast of China in the 16th and 17th centuries.
description: brown slipware freehand scroll pattern over chocolate brown
creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
